dialog.name: Ryor
dialog.message: Hello! I'll be teaching you the vowels!

dialog.name: Ryor
dialog.message: Before anything, you must remember that each hiragana character is a syllable.

dialog.name: Ryor
dialog.message: In their romanization or romaji, they are usually represented by more than one letter.

dialog.name: Ryor
dialog.message: In this game, we will be teaching you the 46 basic hiragana syllables. They are divided in to 9 families.

dialog.name: Ryor
dialog.message: Each game screen or worlds has 3 families.

dialog.name: Ryor
dialog.message: You can click next on the main menu to look at the next worlds, but you won't be able to enter them yet.

dialog.name: Ryor
dialog.message: Anyways, we'll start with the first family: the vowels.

dialog.name: Ryor
dialog.message: This is read as 'a'.

dialog.name: Ryor
dialog.message: This is read as 'i'.

dialog.name: Ryor
dialog.message: This is read as 'u'.

dialog.name: Ryor
dialog.message: This is read as 'e'.

dialog.name: Ryor
dialog.message: This is read as 'o'.

dialog.name: Ryor
dialog.message: Let's go over them again.

dialog.name: Ryor
dialog.message: This is read as 'a'.

dialog.name: Ryor
dialog.message: This is read as 'i'.

dialog.name: Ryor
dialog.message: This is read as 'u'.

dialog.name: Ryor
dialog.message: This is read as 'e'.

dialog.name: Ryor
dialog.message: This is read as 'o'.

dialog.name: Ryor
dialog.message: Don't worry if you can't remember all of them right now. You can always click review on the world map screen.

dialog.name: Ryor
dialog.message: But a better way to memorize them is to train!

dialog.name: Ryor
dialog.message: Go to the reading room so you can Train by yourself.

dialog.name: Ryor
dialog.message: After that, I will be willing to Practice with you!
